snippet: With federal and state courts handing down decisions on ballot casting and counting, the presidential election may hinge partly on last-minute legal battles by both parties.
abstract: November presidential election may hinge in part on last-minute legal battles over when and how ballots should be cast and counted, particularly if the race remains tight in battleground states; in recent weeks, nearly a dozen decisions in federal and state courts on early voting, provisional ballots and voter identification requirements have driven the rules in conflicting directions, with some favoring Republicans and others favoring Democrats.
lead_paragraph: With federal and state courts handing down decisions on ballot casting and counting, the presidential election may hinge partly on last-minute legal battles by both parties.

headline.seo: Legal Battles on Voting May Prove a Critical Issue in Election
headline.main: A Tight Election May Be Tangled in Legal Battles
headline.print_headline: A Tight Election May Be Tangled In Legal Battles
